title: safe - sans serif typeface
content:
Initially I thought it was Helvetica but the lowercase ’a’ is incorrect? Any ideas please.

Thanks in advance

Chad

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205092842im_/http:/typophile.com/files/safe_4522.jpg)

 [‹ Anyone know what this font is?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205092842/http:/typophile.com/node/52210 "Go to previous forum topic") [does anyone know what this is? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205092842/http:/typophile.com/node/52227 "Go to next forum topic")
author: ichad

comments.content:
Really? Its coming out too thick for my liking. Medium is more the weight?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205092842im_/http:/typophile.com/files/safe2_5955.jpg)

It _is_ Neue Helvetica Bold, absolutely.

Look [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205092842/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/helvetica-neue/) or [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205092842/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/neue_helvetica_std_75_bold/).

NO. It’s freaking NOT Helvetica 65 Medium.  
Look at the lc ‘a’.
It is for sure bold... the tail of the lc ’a’ flips out in medium, but terminates facing down in bold...

_“Really? Its coming out too thick for my liking._

That’s because the left sample is light text on dark background which makes it look heavier. See what happens when you invert this.

Just one more reason it’s bold ;^)
